title: Windows : Which process sent TCP/IP packet?
content:
How do I find out which process has sent TCP/IP network packet?

Are there some tools that can easily do this? Like in Linux.

comments.text: You can use ports to associate processes with TCP/IP traffic. netstat can be used for this purpose. For further information: stackoverflow.com/questions/48198/…
Check this link from Microsoft for out-of-box tools blogs.technet.microsoft.com/nettracer/2010/08/02/…

answers_data.content: You can use the  procmon to see which processes send and receive network packets. Procmon is a tool in windows Sysinternals tools set,you can download from this link
